i have not interest in the greek life.
prosepective nursing staff, lpns, or rns
the basement of goodwyn hall. i didn't even know it was there until we have a tornado warning and i was stuck there for three and a half hours.
i don't live on campus, so i don't attend as many events as i should but i've been told that the sports events and rallies are very exciting!
be ready. if you did well in high school, then this won't impact you as much; but if you struggled, this university will help you immensely in catching up then expanding upon your knowledge.

the university as a whole is very competent; the staff and faculty, the technical support and the overall impression invoke a feeling of high regard. the facilities, although undergoing reconstruction, are shaping up to be quite nice. the only negative thing i have to say about the university is that i have only a couple more years left.

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Micah from Wetumpka, AL 09/18/2010 Reviewer is Researching this school. Reviewer has been to campus. 9 out of 9 people found this review useful. 2 of 42 Categories Comments Bang for the buck if you are an Alabama native and plan to go into business this is the best deal you can get. Will enjoy being here the people at and around the college are great. i have lived in this area most of my life so i can tell you that Montgomery is not the most exciting city so you might find your self bored from time to time. Will learn a lot this college has one of the best business programs world wide, and coupled with the fact that most classes have 30 or less students in them the education is second to none. Login
